alert.note: Alert for Scotts Bluff; South Sioux (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 09 at 4:40PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Scotts Bluff, southern Sioux, southwestern Niobrara, Goshen and northeastern Platte Counties through 445 PM MDT... At 339 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northeast of Morrill, or 16 miles east of Torrington, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Scottsbluff, Torrington, Gering, Mitchell, Terrytown, Morrill, Minatare, Lingle, Lyman, Fort Laramie, Yoder, Stegall, Hubbard Hill, Fort Laramie National Historic Site, Veteran, Lake Minatare, Huntley, Lake Minatare Campground, Scotts Bluff National Monument and Jay Em. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
